## Subsection

- $\mathbb{N}$ is the collection of natural numbers: 1, 2, 3, etc.
- $\mathbb{R}$ is the collection of real numbers: -2.53, 0.1, 1.3, etc.
- $\in$ means: "is part of". $x \in \mathbb{R}$ means $x$ is part of the collection of real numbers.
